intro: Lasia stipitata, commonly known as the slender lasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Lasia stipitata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
